website_summaries.verdict: MSI improves the cooling, noise, and performance of the already powerful Radeon R9 290X GPU. It's very well built, with extra features, but it lags behind rivals on price and performance.
pros: Very impressive build quality and feature set
cons: Significantly pricier than basic versions of AMD Radeon R9 290X
Outpaced in some tests by rival GPUs

customer_reviews.title: It takes of 3 PCI slots and requires 2 8 pin and 1 pin connection so i would recommend having a modular power supply to go with
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional performance especially when i was using MSI Afterburner clocked it up to 1200MHz with a memory clock of 1300MHz...Currently i use this card for a Asus V248 HD monitor pushes games and other applications at Ultra settings at 80-100 FPS still yet to combine it with the AMD FX 8350 but i'm sure these two will make a decent pair together..This card is very large so don't think for one minute it will fit in a normal case...It takes of 3 PCI slots and requires 2 8 pin and 1 pin connection so i would recommend having a modular power supply to go with it...Other than that its a done deal best GPU i've ever had hands down..
customer_reviews.author: Solomon

customer_reviews.title: stunning!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced 2 GTX 456's (SLI) with this beast, and it blows all expectations out of the water. Fairly quiet co side ring the 3 fans. And runs under 60c at load. Pretty damned amazing! I run 6048x1080 so the memory and bandwidth make huge displays vey possible. I can run most everything on high if not ultra settings. And considering the real estate that is being rendered, that is really impressive. (This card comes stock OCed to the GPU frequency of its competitor) this one if better than it's competition for large display and multidisplay setups. Especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: White Fox

customer_reviews.title: Amazing graphics card
customer_reviews.text: Amazing graphics card. It's easy to install, optimize, and clean. It is quiet when under stress and remains cool due to the tri fan config. It's very much worth the price. It is the best 290 I have ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Kiro

customer_reviews.title: Do not hesitate to buy!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! I got this card for $350 and it's a true work of art. From the luxurious box to the sheer size and quality of the card, it doesn't disappoint. Msi has always been my favorite brand because they have never let me down like others. I couldn't be happier! Thank you MSI and Amazon!!!
customer_reviews.author: OleP

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I got this card to replace another card. No crashes, black screens, nothing like the previous card. I love it and I'm glad I sent the other one back. Very very pleased with this purchase! Runs all the games I want on ultra with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Creek

customer_reviews.title: No regrets, no getting back now.
customer_reviews.text: I own this graphics card for a few months now, and I can't be happier with it. Every game I throw at it, it plays it really smooth at ultra settings (Assassins Creed Unity, GTA V, Lords of the Fallen, Middle Earth SoM, Alien Isolation, and more). Never had ANY issues with AC5, not even one bug, crushes or black screens at ultra setting. It's quite impressive this GC. The best part of it: With my NZXT Phantom ATX, I have no trouble with temperature. Really good choice for real gaming experience !
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin B.

customer_reviews.title: This card is something else
customer_reviews.text: This card is something else, very powerful, reliable, and really slick looking when it's running. I am sure if you are looking at this card you have read the reviews, but I have a few points of advice. First, do not try to run the card without turning on the LN2 BIOS. When the LN2 is off, the card will throttle itself and you will get some pretty bad screen artifacts and tearing. Second: this is an air-cooled card, that is the way it's made. Those 3 fans on there can get really loud so plan on wearing headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: Bang For Buck! Really quiet for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: This beast of a card performs outstandingly good. All my games run over 60 fps with this at 1080p. I will be adding another soon to accommodate the new Freesync 34" LG 34UM67 I'm getting that's coming out soon.
customer_reviews.author: Henri Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Another perfect MSI card
customer_reviews.text: I love MSI. Its just a wonderful card and works great with the EK block especially made for this card. The Samsung memory outperforms the Hynix and Elpida memory in other r9 series cards.
customer_reviews.author: 0Day

customer_reviews.title: Excellent GPU!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best GPUs I have used in a while, great built in cooling, build quality is excellent, can handle any game I throw at it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan123

customer_reviews.title: amazing gaming gpu
customer_reviews.text: works as intended, stylish heatsink and cover, amazing gaming gpu.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: I love this kick ass graphic card
customer_reviews.text: I love this kick ass graphic card. Out of the box is perfect but when overclock omg. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: clay

customer_reviews.title: Awesome card! This thing is huge
customer_reviews.text: Awesome card! This thing is huge!! Using on an Asus z97a with a i5-4690k, nothing overclocked, average 90 fps on ultra settings in BF4!
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: This maybe the most cost efficient 290X. It's heavy but if you use a PC case like RV02 (FT02), then this won't be a problem. It's very quiet for a 290X and I am not regretted. The fancy lights are not necessary for me but it's good to have them.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY FAST!!!
customer_reviews.text: Both of my MSI Lightning R9 290X are so stupidly fast, run so cold and let u play so smoothly everything.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome card. My son installed it right away and has nothing but great things to say about the ease of installation and gaming speed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, untill it didn't
customer_reviews.text: Pros: low temps, and a massive upgrade from my old HD5870 Cons: it stopped working after three months. I'm currently going through MSI's RMA process
customer_reviews.author: Allan Noble

customer_reviews.title: Pure muscle just make sure you use all power connecter with LN2 mode and Enjoy!
customer_reviews.text: Beast with no sound, Pure muscle just make sure you use all power connecter with LN2 mode and Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: gaurav shrivastava

customer_reviews.title: The card is amazing, I got unlucky and had a faulty card ...
customer_reviews.text: The card is amazing, I got unlucky and had a faulty card but what I did get to see was impressive. Got a nice refund though.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Little

customer_reviews.title: awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This product is simply awesome. It runs reaaaalllyy cool and is super quiet! I'm leaving 4 stars because the product did not come with a voucher for free games so I had to send few emails and the one that has been sent was not working.. Therefore I had to contact amd and amazon again. Anyway, the point is that the product is incredible and i'm sure I'll be able to run any game using max settings for a while ;)
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: DOA rampant issues with this card and it's drivers. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Aceves III

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive build quality and feature set..
customer_reviews.text: MSI improves the cooling, noise, and performance of the already powerful Radeon R9 290X GPU. It's very well built, with extra features. Pros: + Very impressive build quality and feature set. + Overclocked out of the box. + Much quieter than stock R9 290X. Cons: - Significantly pricier than basic versions of AMD Radeon R9 290X. - Outpaced in some tests by rival GPUs. On performance alone, it would be worth comparing to this Nvidia Geforce Gtx here:
